meta.title: Survey - Personality vs Programmer Earnings - Sławomir Woźniak
meta.description: Check how your personality affects your earnings in IT. Fill out a short survey and compare your results with other programmers.

intro.title: Programmer Survey
intro.subtitle: personality vs earnings
intro.description: Help us research how personality traits affect earnings in IT. Filling out the survey will take about 5 minutes.

screening.title: Before we start...
screening.subtitle: Let's make sure this survey is for you
screening.instruction: If you meet these conditions, click below to continue.
screening.confirm_button: Yes, I am a programmer in Poland

personality.title: Personality Test
personality.instruction: Rate how well the following statements describe you (1 = not at all, 5 = very accurately)

employment.title: Employment Information
employment.subtitle: Last step before sending
employment.error_generic: An error occurred while sending the survey

form.experience_label: Work experience as a programmer (in years)
form.salary_hint: For B2B: after paying ZUS, PIT and accounting

thank_you.title: Thank you for participating in the study!
thank_you.description: Your answers have been saved. Below you will find your personality profile.

already_submitted.title: You have already completed the survey
already_submitted.description: Thank you for participating in the study! You can only fill out the survey once from one IP address.

extraversion.label: Extraversion
extraversion.high: People with high extraversion are energetic, sociable, talkative and bold. They like to be the center of attention and draw energy from contact with people.
extraversion.low: People with low extraversion are more reserved, value peace and privacy. They may seem taciturn or withdrawn in a large group, preferring contacts in a smaller group.

agreeableness.label: Agreeableness
agreeableness.high: Highly agreeable people are trusting, altruistic, warm and cooperative. They strive for agreement and harmony in relationships.
agreeableness.low: People with lower agreeableness may be more skeptical, critical and competitive. They more often put their own interests above the interests of others.

conscientiousness.label: Conscientiousness
conscientiousness.high: High conscientiousness means good organization, dutifulness, accuracy and determination in pursuing a goal. Such people like order and planning.
conscientiousness.low: Low conscientiousness can be associated with greater spontaneity, flexibility, but also less attention to detail and regularity.

emotionalStability.label: Emotional Stability
emotionalStability.high: Emotionally stable people are calm, balanced and resistant to stress. They experience strong negative emotions like fear or anger less often.
emotionalStability.low: Lower stability (higher neuroticism) is associated with more frequent mood swings, anxiety, irritability and a stronger reaction to stress.

intellect.label: Intellect (Openness)
intellect.high: High intellect (openness) characterizes creative people who are curious about the world, have a rich imagination and broad interests. They like novelty and abstract thinking.
intellect.low: A lower score may indicate pragmatism, keeping one's feet on the ground and preferring proven solutions and concretes instead of abstract ideas.

traits.average_description: Your score is average, which means you show traits from both poles depending on the situation, or they are not strongly marked in you.

questions.e_plus_1: I am the life of the party.
questions.u_minus_1: I don't care much about others.
questions.s_plus_2: I get chores done right away.
questions.i_minus_2: I have difficulty understanding abstract ideas.
questions.e_plus_3: I talk to a lot of different people at parties.
questions.u_minus_3: I am not interested in other people's problems.
questions.s_minus_3: I often forget to put things back in their proper place.
questions.i_minus_4: I do not have a good imagination.
